intro: Minuartia rubra subsp. rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate and often have a bluish-gray hue due to a dense covering of fine hairs. This subspecies is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in harsh, cold environments.
